Comment: As a libertarian, I don’t support what they did. Watch the video. The sheriff steps away and has plainclothes security guards drag her out instead as she asks them if they’re deputies and for their names. As cringe and hyperbolic as she was being screaming “assault” at the very beginning, it doesn’t take away from the fact that plainclothes non-deputized security who didn’t identify themselves did physically drag her away at the behest of a law enforcement official. That’s over the line and I wouldn’t want democrats or republicans approving of that. The question of whether she should have been allowed to stay is debatable. The method though, is clearly some bootlicker nonsense.
Author: dayda

Comment: As they should be. They’re not law enforcement officers and it was a public venue. They are not allowed to touch or remove someone, just like you or I are not allowed to do so. Whoever hired the public security firm is probably looking at a lawsuit too.
